title: Understanding the Matrix
text: The given matrix is an augmented matrix, which represents a system of linear equations. Each row of the matrix corresponds to one equation in the system, with the coefficients of $$x$$, $$y$$, and the constant on the right-hand side.

title: Solving the System
text: In order to solve the system, set the variables in each row equal to the constant on the right-hand side, then solve for the variables.

title: Gaussian Elimination
text: Start solving the system using Gaussian elimination. To eliminate the first variable $$x$$ from the second and third rows, use the first row to adjust the other rows.

title: Eliminating X
text: Use $$-0.4$$ (in the second row) to eliminate the $$x-term$$ by adding 4*(Row 1) to Row $$2$$.

title: Eliminating X
text: Use $$0.6$$ (in the third row) to eliminate the $$x-term$$ by subtracting 6*(Row 1) from Row $$3$$.

title: Finding $$y$$
text: What is the value of $$y$$ after eliminating $$x$$ and solving for $$y$$?

title: Finding $$z$$
text: What is the value of $$z$$ after eliminating $$x$$ and solving for $$z$$?

title: Finding $$x$$
text: Substitue the values of $$y$$ and $$z$$ to solve for $$x$$.
